page.title: 02FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: {PRINCIPAL FEATURES PAST & PRESENT WISBECH & UPWELL TRAMWAY The tramway was opened on 8th September 1884. The tram finally closed down on 20th May 1966 because more and more lorries started to carry the freight. It was in operation for 82 years. It ran from Upwell to Wisbech . The stations on the line were Upwell,Outwell village, Outwell Basin, Boyces bridge, Elm bridge and Wisbech. The early trams were powered by steam. The later ones were powered by diesel. Here are some facts obout the tramway in 1884. 1. The first tram left Wisbech at 6.45 a.m. 2. It arrived in Upwell at 7.45 a.m. 3. The last tram left Wisbech at 7.50 p.m. 4. The last tram arrives in Upwell at 8.50 p.m.
